item.text: “‘When a person sins in that he hears a public curse against one who fails to testify and he is a witness (he either saw or knew what had happened) and he does not make it known, then he will bear his punishment for iniquity.

<st data-num="0176" class="">Or</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">when</st> there is<n id="1" /> a <st data-num="05315" class="">person</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="05060" class="">touches</st> <st data-num="03605 01697">anything</st> <st data-num="02931" class="">ceremonially unclean</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0176" class="">whether</st> the <st data-num="05038" class="">carcass</st> of an <st data-num="02931" class="">unclean</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">wild animal</st>, <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> the <st data-num="05038" class="">carcass</st> of an <st data-num="02931" class="">unclean</st> <st data-num="0929" class="">domesticated animal</st>, <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> the <st data-num="05038" class="">carcass</st> of an <st data-num="02931" class="">unclean</st> <st data-num="08318" class="">creeping thing</st>, even if he did not <st data-num="05956" class="">realize</st> it,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> has become <st data-num="02931" class="">unclean</st> and <st data-num="0816" class="">is guilty</st>;<n id="4" />

<st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">when</st> he <st data-num="05060" class="">touches</st> <st data-num="0120" class="">human</st> <st data-num="02932" class="">uncleanness</st> with regard to <st data-num="03605 02932">anything</st> by <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> he can <st data-num="02930" class="">become unclean</st>,<n id="1" /> even if he did not <st data-num="05956" class="">realize</st> it, but <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> has later <st data-num="03045" class="">come to know</st> it and <st data-num="0816" class="">is guilty</st>;

<st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">when</st> a <st data-num="05315" class="">person</st> <st data-num="07650" class="">swears an oath</st>, <st data-num="0981" class="">speaking thoughtlessly</st><n id="1" /> with his <st data-num="08193" class="">lips</st>, whether to <st data-num="07489" class="">do evil</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> to <st data-num="03190" class="">do good</st>, with regard to <st data-num="03605" class="">anything</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> the <st data-num="0120" class="">individual</st> might <st data-num="0981" class="">speak thoughtlessly</st> in an <st data-num="07621" class="">oath</st>, even if he did not <st data-num="05956" class="">realize</st> it, but <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> has later <st data-num="03045" class="">come to know</st> it and <st data-num="0816" class="">is guilty</st> with regard to <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> oaths<n id="2" />—

<st data-num="03588" class="">when</st> an individual <st data-num="0816" class="">becomes guilty</st> with regard to <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of <st data-num="0428" class="">these things</st><n id="1" /> he must <st data-num="03034" class="">confess</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">how</st> he has <st data-num="02398" class="">sinned</st>,<n id="2" />

and he must bring his penalty for guilt to the Lord for his sin that he has committed—a female from the flock, whether a female sheep or a female goat, for a sin offering. So the priest will make atonement on his behalf for his sin.

“‘If he cannot afford an animal from the flock, he must bring his penalty for guilt for his sin that he has committed, two turtledoves or two young pigeons, to the Lord, one for a sin offering and one for a burnt offering.

He must <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st> them <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> and <st data-num="07126" class="">present</st> <st data-num="07223" class="">first</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">the one that</st> is for a <st data-num="02403" class="">sin offering</st>. The priest<n id="1" /> must <st data-num="04454" class="">pinch</st><n id="2" /> its <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> at the <st data-num="04136" class="">nape</st> of its <st data-num="06203" class="">neck</st>, but must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0914" class="">sever</st> the head from the body.<n id="3" />

Then he must <st data-num="05137" class="">sprinkle</st><n id="1" /> some of the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> of the <st data-num="02403" class="">sin offering</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07023" class="">wall</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>, and the <st data-num="07604" class="">remainder</st> of the <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st><n id="2" /> must be <st data-num="04680" class="">squeezed out</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="03247" class="">base</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>—<st data-num="01931" class="">it</st> is a <st data-num="02403" class="">sin offering</st>.

The second bird he must make a burnt offering according to the standard regulation. So the priest will make atonement on behalf of this person for his sin which he has committed, and he will be forgiven.

“‘If he cannot afford two turtledoves or two young pigeons, he must bring as his offering for his sin which he has committed a tenth of an ephah of choice wheat flour for a sin offering. He must not place olive oil on it, and he must not put frankincense on it, because it is a sin offering.

He must bring it to the priest, and the priest must scoop out from it a handful as its memorial portion and offer it up in smoke on the altar on top of the other gifts of the Lord—it is a sin offering.

So the priest will make atonement on his behalf for his sin which he has committed by doing one of these things, and he will be forgiven. The remainder of the offering will belong to the priest like the grain offering.’”
Then the Lord spoke to Moses:

“When a person commits a trespass and sins by straying unintentionally from the regulations about the Lord’s holy things, then he must bring his penalty for guilt to the Lord, a flawless ram from the flock, convertible into silver shekels according to the standard of the sanctuary shekel, for a guilt offering.

And whatever holy thing he violated he must restore and must add one-fifth to it and give it to the priest. So the priest will make atonement on his behalf with the guilt-offering ram, and he will be forgiven.

“If a person sins and violates any of the Lord’s commandments that must not be violated (although he did not know it at the time, but later realizes he is guilty), then he will bear his punishment for iniquity

and must <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st> a <st data-num="08549" class="">flawless</st> <st data-num="0352" class="">ram</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="06629" class="">flock</st>, <st data-num="06187" class="">convertible</st> into silver shekels,<n id="1" /> for a <st data-num="0817" class="">guilt offering</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st>. So the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> will <st data-num="03722" class="">make atonement</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="05921" class="">behalf</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> his <st data-num="07684" class="">error</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> he <st data-num="07683" class="">committed</st><n id="3" /> (although he <st data-num="01931" class="">himself</st> had <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">known</st> it), and he will be <st data-num="05545" class="">forgiven</st>.<n id="4" />
It is a guilt offering; he was surely guilty before the Lord.”
